N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2053.8 - Requests for records

State Regulations
(a) All
requests for records must comply with sections 2053.4 and
2053.6
of this Part, reasonably
describe the record sought, and whenever possible, supply identifying
information that assists the corporation in locating the records
sought. (b) Requests based upon
categories of information described in a notice of a system of records or a
privacy impact statement, referred to in section
2053.15
of this Part, shall be
deemed to reasonably describe the record sought. (c) Within five business days after receipt
of a request, the corporation shall: (1)
make
the record available for inspection, without codes or symbols unless an
accompanying document explaining such codes or symbols is also
provided; (2)
upon payment of or
offer to pay the fees referred to below, permit the data subject to copy the
record; (3)
deny access to the
record in whole or in part and explain in writing the reasons therefor; or
(4)
acknowledge receipt of the
request and state the approximate date when the request will be granted or
denied, which date shall not exceed 30 days from the date of the
acknowledgment. Notes
